author: bridge-bot
content: <nicoserranop> It is worth pointing out that the GitHub and eth addresses are embedded in the ceremony transcript for all eternity. This POAP is only a commemorative item but your GitHub contribution will stay on the transcript and you can show people you participated in it by showing your username in the transcript

author: trent_vanepps
content:
I believe the POAP Checkout product you have to be able to sign a tx with the Private Key associated with the eligible address.

if you're saying you want to sign with the compromised address but send the POAP to a different address - i don't think they support this

author: roadia.eth
content: well hacks happens exactly when you DONT see it right? so you're sure you are in a right place but after months it turns out to be a scam link. isn't it?

author: roadia.eth
content: and why you dont reply with your own accounts here ser? people think its a bot or an AI talking to them, last night a dude was cursing this bot in a reply. this is so confusing to us.

author: trent_vanepps
content:
i would help if i could, unfortunately the only extent in this case is to offer my time to understand your problem and think through solutions. 

the Ceremony produced a final output. any change to it breaks the collective social consensus that this is the legitimate output, so it cannot be changed

the list of addresses which contributed to the Ceremony output was passed to the POAP team. even if it were possible for the POAP team to swap in your new address in place of the old one for the whitelist, it would be strange in the future to see an address which did not contribute to the Ceremony claim the POAP. for this reason, i don't think it makes sense to pursue

i'm sorry your wallet was compromised, that's a tough thing to deal with

author: trent_vanepps
content:
if there is still ETH in the account, you may be able to claim to the address and move to a fresh address

if someone is running a sweeper bot that claims any ETH you send there, i'm afraid it will be much harder to do. possibly through a private relay but i don't know if the things held at your wallet warrant that much effort
